snippet: A federal judge on Tuesday did not approve the proposed $765 million settlement of the N.F.L. concussion case, saying it might not be enough to cover all of the retirees’ claims.
abstract: Federal Judge Anita B Brody rejects proposed $765 million settlement between the NFL and more than 4,500 retired players who sued the league and accused it of hiding dangers of concussion; expresses doubt that there is enough money to cover potential costs for 18,000 retirees over the 65-year life of the agreement.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Tuesday did not approve the proposed $765 million settlement of the N.F.L. concussion case, saying it might not be enough to cover all of the retirees’ claims.

headline.main: Judge Rejects N.F.L. Settlement, for Now
headline.print_headline: Judge Rejects N.F.L. Settlement, for Now
